Instruction: Peel and dice potatoes into small cubes.
In a large pot, cook bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove bacon from the pot and crumble.
In the same pot with bacon drippings, add chopped onion and minced garlic. Cook until softened.
Add diced potatoes to the pot and pour in chicken or vegetable broth.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until potatoes are tender.
Using a potato masher or immersion blender, partially mash the potatoes to thicken the soup.
Stir in milk, cheddar cheese, and sour cream until cheese is melted and soup is heated through.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with crumbled bacon and chopped green onions if desired.
